description_txt: stated on January 20, 2011 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: A national organization says Georgia has one of America’s toughest ethics laws.

description_txt: stated on January 23, 2011 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: Poll results from the past 35 years show that State of the Union speeches "do not move" presidential approval numbers.

description_txt: stated on January 16, 2011 in a fact-sheet.:
quote_txt: More people die from "medical misadventures" than firearm accidents nationally and in Florida.

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2011 in an op-ed column:
quote_txt: Texas leads "the nation in the percentage of residents without health insurance."

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2011 in a meeting with Journal Sentinel reporters and editors:
quote_txt: "We’ve saved over $100 million of (health care) costs" in Milwaukee County. "I did that."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2011 in a FoxNews interview:
quote_txt: Says the Defense Department shrink-wrapped $10.8 billion in American money, loaded it on 175 pallets and put it on a transport plane to Iraq where they passed out $100 bills and no one has any receipts.

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: George Allen voted for budgets that increased the national debt by $16,400 for every second he served in the U.S. Senate.

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "Despite the administration telling us (health care reform) was going to reduce health care costs, they now acknowledge it's going to dramatically increase health care costs."

description_txt: stated on December 27, 2010 in a website posting:
quote_txt: Says a Portland school gives Muslim students "their own school provided prayer room, prayer rugs," and lets them "out of class five times a day to pray to Allah."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2010 in a letter to a Senate committee:
quote_txt: "New England already has access to ample supplies of natural gas."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2011 in an article in The Oregonian:
quote_txt: A test last month at the MAX station at 162nd Avenue and East Burnside saw crime down 41 percent compared with December 2009

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2011 in the State of the Commonwealth address:
quote_txt: "It is estimated that every $100 million spent on construction generates 3,000 new jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2011 in his inauguration address:
quote_txt: Says the first word spoken from the moon was "Houston."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2011 in a radio interview on WFLA-AM 970:
quote_txt: "There was no panhandling when I left office."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2011 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: The health care law includes tort reform.

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2011 in a news release.:
quote_txt: The governor has made a "commitment to billions of dollars in debt and new spending without any explanation of how he plans to pay that money back."

description_txt: stated on July 15, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: The financial regulatory bill "will kill jobs."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2011 in an op-ed column.:
quote_txt: Says that "data from the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities suggest that the Texas budget gap is worse than New York’s, about as bad as California’s, but not quite up to New Jersey levels."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2011 in a chain email and -- briefly -- a union web site:
quote_txt: Gov. Scott Walker hired convicted Assembly Speaker Scott Jensen to oversee a raid on the state employee retirement system to help balance the state budget.

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2011 in a speech in the Ohio House of Representatives:
quote_txt: "Ben Franklin once quipped that only two things in life were certain: death and taxes. I think even he didn't envision that the tax man would visit on the day of your death."

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2010 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: The impact of the 2010 federal health care legislation will be "huge" on Georgia.

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2011 in a bill introduced on the House floor.:
quote_txt: The health care law is "job killing."

description_txt: stated on December 28, 2010 in an interview.:
quote_txt: Says 2010 was the "worst year ever for America's doctors" reimbursed by Medicare.

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2011 in comments at the Liberty County Chamber of Commerce annual dinner.:
quote_txt: "92 percent" of President Barack Obama's administration has "never worked outside government."

description_txt: stated on January 16, 2011 in an interview after a town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "We had a debate on whether ‘ObamaCare’ was the way to go to fix up health care and the American voters said no -- emphatically."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2011 in an MSNBC interview:
quote_txt: Under federal law, Jared Loughner "would not have been able to buy a gun" had he been identified as mentally ill.

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2011 in comments on the House floor:
quote_txt: Between 2000 and 2006,  "health insurance company profits quadrupled."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2011 in comments on the House floor:
quote_txt: "Between the year 2000 and 2006, (insurance) premiums in this country doubled."

description_txt: stated on December 25, 2010 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: The nation's food supply is "99.99 percent safe."

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2011 in a news conference:
quote_txt: On whether the state should privatize the Ohio Turnpike.
